importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the incident when the offensive message was displayed during the Hispanic Heritage Night game.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The incident occurred during the first intermission of the game on October 19, 2025, during a live event at SAP Center.

keyTakeAways: The San Jose Sharks apologized for displaying a message during a Hispanic Heritage Night event that seemed to praise Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), which fans and media perceived as offensive.
The message on the scoreboard, 'SJ SHARKS FANS LOVE ICE !! GET ‘EM BOYZ!', was found to be externally submitted and inadvertently displayed during a game against the Pittsburgh Penguins.
The Sharks confirmed the message did not reflect their values and admitted it was not caught during standard review processes.
The incident sparked public backlash, with fans expressing outrage, including Jessica Clark, who called the message 'appalling' despite being a long-time fan.

The event occurred during 'Los Tiburones Night,' a celebration of the team's commitment to the Bay Area’s Hispanic community, highlighting a clash between cultural celebration and potential offensiveness.
The Sharks are investigating the source of the message and have committed to ensuring such incidents do not happen again.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The San Jose Sharks apologized for inadvertently displaying a message during their Hispanic Heritage Night event that appeared to praise Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), sparking backlash from fans who viewed it as offensive. The message, 'SJ SHARKS FANS LOVE ICE !! GET ‘EM BOYZ!', was posted during the first intermission of a game against the Pittsburgh Penguins at SAP Center and was not approved through standard review processes. The team stated the message did not reflect their values and is investigating its origin. The incident occurred during 'Los Tiburones Night,' a celebration of the team’s commitment to the Bay Area’s Hispanic community, highlighting tensions between cultural appreciation and the potential for offensive messaging.
title: San Jose Sharks Apologize for 'Offensively Worded Message' Displayed During Hispanic Heritage Night
